title: 'Notorious' stand, beer towers, and Boxing Day madness: MCG braces for Australia vs India - The Times of India
summary:
Notorious stand, beer towers, and Boxing Day madness: MCG braces for Australia vs India

Publication Date: December 26, 2023 | Source: Times of India

On December 26, the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) is set to host a sold-out crowd of nearly 100,000 for the highly-anticipated Boxing Day Test between Australia and India. Security measures have been ramped up in response to the expected rowdy atmosphere, particularly from a notorious group known for their loud behavior.

  • Over 100,000 spectators expected for the match, with additional security personnel deployed.
  • Security staff count increased from 10 to up to 20 per block to manage the crowd.
  • Tickets for resale are fetching steep premiums, with prices rising from 30 AUD to upwards of 150 AUD.
  • Local marketplaces buzzing with fans reselling tickets, creating a festive and chaotic environment.
"They just come and drink. That loud bunch in those blue blocks. Beer just flows and expect the beer glass towers to get taller as the game progresses." - Security guard at MCG

The excitement leading up to the match showcases the vibrant cricket culture in Australia, with festivities continuing through the New Year.
newTitle: MCG Prepares for Australia vs India: Anticipating Boxing Day Chaos

title: After Getting Sacked, Prithvi Shaw Will Now Lead This Mumbai Cricket Association Team. But It's A De.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
After Getting Sacked, Prithvi Shaw Will Now Lead This Mumbai Cricket Association Team. But It's A Demotion

Publication Date: August 26, 2023 | Source: NDTV

Prithvi Shaw, who faced disciplinary issues leading to his exclusion from Mumbai's Vijay Hazare Trophy squad, has been given another chance as captain of the MCA Colts in the Police Invitation Shield Cricket Tournament 2024-25.

  • Shaw's past good statistics in List A cricket did not save him from being dropped due to indiscipline.
  • Despite his drop, the MCA shows willingness to support Shaw, highlighting a potential path to redemption.
  • Concerns regarding Shaw's fitness and training attendance have been raised by anonymous MCA sources.
  • Should he perform poorly, this tournament could mark his last opportunity to represent Mumbai.
“The fitness concern is there, but the performance is also not there currently. He needs to work on his fitness, discipline, and performance.” - Anonymous source within MCA

This opportunity in the Police Invitation Shield could be pivotal for Shaw, as his future in Mumbai cricket hangs in the balance.
newTitle: Prithvi Shaw Takes Demotion in Stride as He Leads Mumbai Cricket Association Colts

title: 'I felt like I was using a toothpick': Michael Hussey recalls facing a young Jasprit Bumrah - The Times of India
summary:
Michael Hussey Reflects on Facing Young Jasprit Bumrah

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Former Australian cricketer Michael Hussey shares his memories of facing a young Jasprit Bumrah during the 2014 IPL, providing insight into Bumrah’s unconventional style and remarkable career journey.

  • Hussey recalled feeling like he was using a toothpick when facing Bumrah, emphasizing the bowler's deceptive action and fierce speed.
  • Initially, Bumrah was seen as a white-ball specialist, with doubts about his ability in Test cricket due to his unique bowling technique.
  • Hussey expressed admiration for Bumrah’s evolution into one of the world’s best bowlers.
  • He recounted a pivotal moment when Bumrah dismissed AB de Villiers in 2014 and provided advice on maintaining humility and respect in the game.
“I felt like I was using a toothpick.” - Michael Hussey on facing Jasprit Bumrah
“Isn't he doing it bloody well at the moment? It's just phenomenal to see how he's grown.” - Michael Hussey

Hussey’s reflections highlight Bumrah’s impressive journey from a young bowler in the nets to a world-class player, emphasizing the importance of skill and character in cricket.
newTitle: Michael Hussey Reflects on Facing Young Jasprit Bumrah

title: Ravindra Jadeja Slammed For Speaking Hindi In Australia By Media Outlet. Report Termed As 'Hypocrisy.. - NDTV Sports
summary:
Ravindra Jadeja Faces Backlash for Speaking Hindi in Australia, Media Calls It 'Hypocrisy'

Date: December 21, 2024 Source: NDTV

The India vs Australia Test series has been marred by controversy as Ravindra Jadeja faced criticism for conducting a press conference in Hindi. This has sparked debate among media outlets regarding language and communication barriers in international sports contexts.

  • Ravindra Jadeja held a press conference before the Boxing Day Test, where he answered questions in Hindi.
  • Australian media expressed their frustration, labeling the situation as 'annoying' since they were unable to engage with Jadeja in English.
  • Indian journalists defended Jadeja, suggesting that the Australian media was overreacting to the situation.
  • This incident follows another controversy involving Virat Kohli and media interactions at the airport.
“Several social media users termed the report as 'hypocrisy'.”

In conclusion, the incident reflects ongoing tensions between media expectations and individual language preferences in international sports events.
newTitle: Ravindra Jadeja Faces Backlash for Speaking Hindi in Australia, Media Calls It 'Hypocrisy'

title: 'Build stadium at border': Pakistan batter Shehzad suggests bizarre idea for IND-PAK matches, unhappy with ICC’s plan - Hindustan Times
summary:
Build stadium at border: Pakistan batter Shehzad suggests bizarre idea for IND-PAK matches, unhappy with ICC’s plan

Date: Dec 21, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

Pakistan cricketer Ahmed Shehzad expressed disappointment with the ICC's new hybrid model for India-Pakistan cricket matches, suggesting a controversial idea for a stadium located at the India-Pakistan border.

  • The ICC approved a hybrid model for the upcoming Champions Trophy due to diplomatic tensions.
  • Shehzad believes this decision locks Pakistan out of future chances to host India for ICC events.
  • He proposed building a stadium at the border, with separate entrances for players from both nations.
  • Despite this idea, Shehzad noted practical issues like visa regulations preventing Indian players from crossing over.
  • Pakistan is the defending Champions Trophy winner, having last faced India in the 2024 T20 World Cup.
“Pakistan had a golden chance to host India. ICC cannot back off. PCB has missed the chance I think.” – Ahmed Shehzad

Shehzad's suggestion highlights the ongoing challenges facing cricketing relations between India and Pakistan, reflecting a deep desire for competitive matches amidst political realities.
newTitle: Shehzad Proposes Unique Stadium Idea for India-Pakistan Matches Amid ICC Hybrid Model Plans

title: Robin Uthappa, former India cricketer, faces arrest over provident fund ‘fraud’: Reports - Hindustan Times
summary:
Robin Uthappa Faces Arrest Over Provident Fund Fraud Allegations

Date: Dec 21, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

An arrest warrant has been issued against former Indian cricketer Robin Uthappa in connection with an alleged EPFO fraud case where he failed to deposit provident fund contributions deducted from employees' salaries.

  • An arrest warrant was issued by PF regional commissioner Shadakshari Gopal Reddy.
  • Uthappa is accused of not depositing ₹23 lakh in provident fund contributions while managing Century Lifestyle Brand Private Limited.
  • The warrant mandates the police to arrest Uthappa and return by December 27.
  • Uthappa and his family reportedly reside in Dubai.
  • He has represented India in 59 international matches and was a prominent player in the IPL.
“The warrant which was executed on December 4 has been returned after Mr. Uthappa was found not to be at the Pulakeshinagar residence,” officials said.

This situation highlights serious allegations against Uthappa, affecting his reputation and potentially leading to legal consequences.
newTitle: Robin Uthappa Faces Arrest Over Provident Fund Fraud Allegations

title: Arrest warrant against cricketer Robin Uthappa for failing to deposit employees’ PF into their accounts - The Hindu
summary:
Arrest Warrant Issued for Cricketer Robin Uthappa Over PF Cheating Case

Published: December 21, 2024 11:48 am IST | Source: The Hindu

An arrest warrant has been issued against former India cricketer Robin Uthappa in an alleged Provident Fund (PF) cheating case. The warrant was issued by PF Regional Commissioner Shadakshari Gopal Reddy, who has asked the jurisdictional Pulakeshinagar police to take necessary action.

  • The warrant was executed on December 4 but Uthappa was not found at his residence.
  • Uthappa is accused of deducting PF contributions from employee salaries but failing to deposit those funds into their accounts.
  • He currently resides in Dubai with his family.
“The warrant which was executed on December 4 has been returned after Mr. Uthappa was found not to be at the Pulakeshinagar residence,” officials said.

This incident highlights the serious implications of financial misconduct involving employee welfare funds.
newTitle: Arrest Warrant Issued for Cricketer Robin Uthappa Over PF Cheating Case

summary:
IND vs AUS: Ravindra Jadeja pays tribute to 'on-field mentor' R Ashwin

Publication Date: New Delhi

Source: Times of India

Ravindra Jadeja expressed that he will deeply miss Ravichandran Ashwin, whom he considers an on-field mentor, after Ashwin announced his retirement during the Test series against Australia.

  • Ashwin retires as India’s second-highest wicket-taker in Tests with 537 wickets.
  • He and Jadeja took 587 wickets together in 58 Tests, surpassing the Kumble-Harbhajan duo.
  • Jadeja praised Ashwin's mentorship and their communication during matches.
  • They will reunite in IPL 2025 for Chennai Super Kings.
  • Ashwin reflected on his career and significant memories with teammates.
“This will be my last day as an Indian cricketer in all formats at the international level. I do feel there's a bit of punch left in me as a cricketer, but I would like to expose... I've had a lot of fun.” - R Ashwin

Jadeja's sentiments highlight the bond formed between the two over many years, while Ashwin's retirement marks a significant moment in Indian cricket history.
newTitle: Ravindra Jadeja Pays Tribute to R Ashwin Following His Retirement

summary:
Allan Border Praises Jasprit Bumrah's Impact in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Publication Date: November 22, 2024
Source: Times of India

Jasprit Bumrah, India's pace spearhead, has been the standout performer in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, astonishing audiences and former players alike with his unique bowling style and impressive statistics.

  • Bumrah is the top wicket-taker in the series with 21 wickets from 3 Tests, averaging 10.90.
  • He surpassed Kapil Dev to become India’s top Test wicket-taker in Australia, reaching 53 wickets.
  • Former Australia captain Allan Border lauded Bumrah's unique bowling technique and captaincy skills.
  • In the first Test, Bumrah took 5 wickets for 30 runs and 3 for 42 in the second innings, contributing significantly to India's 295-run victory.
“Bumrah, these days, is on that pedestal... being different, plus having that skill, it's a whole different level of difficulty for the batsman.” - Allan Border

Jasprit Bumrah's exceptional performance and innovative bowling have not only helped his team significantly but have also garnered respect from opponents and former players, marking him as a player to watch in the ongoing series.
newTitle: Allan Border Praises Jasprit Bumrah's Impact in Border-Gavaskar Trophy

Renowned cricketer Virat Kohli has faced emotional challenges while captaining the Indian cricket team, particularly after losses. His wife, Anushka Sharma, shares insights into his mindset during tough times.

World Chess Champion D Gukesh has been criticized by Magnus Carlsen, who called the classical chess format the 'worst way' to determine the best player after Gukesh's historic win.

  • D Gukesh became the youngest-ever world chess champion at 18.
  • He defeated defending champion Ding Liren in Singapore.
  • Carlsen stated that classical chess masks deficiencies in a player's game.
  • Carlsen intends to compete against Gukesh in upcoming tournaments.
